text: And frolicking otters on the UK's riverbanks are just a perfect example.
But otters in fish ponds are not so harmonious.
This video, titled "Fish Under Attack," shows one devious mammal making off with a huge haul.
Having installed a video camera to find out who was stealing fish,...
Not before he made off with 39 prized fish.
Further investigation shows it's not just otters that are a bit handy.
Video evidence reveals that raccoons are just as light-fingered.
Mats, rugs, or scraps of carpet within easy reach of cat flaps are rich pickings for this serial snare.
And it isn't just land-based mammals with a penchant for pocket picking.
Gray seals happy to look their victim in the eye before making a getaway.
Reports have also emerged of vanity crime.
The perpetrators usually come across as charming as a ruse to make off with your bling.
But it's not just the call of the wild that leads to criminal instincts.
Coolheaded cat burglars could be inside your house.
